title: 【やさしい日本語】ウクライナの人(ひと)が、日本(にっぽん)で 人形(にんぎょう)の 作(つく)り方(かた)を 教(おし)える
cleaned_sentences: Ekaterina (Hidari) Russia is attacking its neighboring country, Ukraine.
In March of this year, Ukraine's Ekaterina Chaprinsika fled to Japan with her 3-year-old daughter.
Because I have an older sister in Tagawa City, Fukuoka Prefecture.
We currently live in Tagawa City with two parents and children.
While working in Tagawa City to grow strawberries, I am waiting for the day when I can safely return to Ukraine, where my husband is.
People in Tagawa City support Ekaterina's life.
To thank Ekaterina, she held a meeting to teach her how to make Ukrainian dolls and accessories.
Yasunaga Hinako from Tagawa City also participated.
Yasunaga also has a three-year-old daughter.
"It's great to be able to learn about Ukrainian culture," he said.
The original article is here Easy Japanese We deliver news translated into "easy Japanese" that is easy for foreigners and children to understand.
